newsitem.title: UK: Kalon says current trading shows improvement.
newsitem.headline: Kalon says current trading shows improvement.

text.p: Anglo-French paints and building chemicals manufacturer Kalon Group Plc said on Thursday that current trading was showing a "significant improvement" on the same period last year.
The performance of all the group's divisions is ahead of 1996, chairman Lord Wakeham told the annual general meeting.
"The principal drivers of higher group profitability are the generation of cost savings arising from Kalon's merger with Euridep and lower raw material prices," Wakeham said.
"The continual lowering of operational gearing throughout the group is stimulating higher operating margins which will be optimised by increased seasonal volumes," he added.
Kalon shares were up eight pence at 138-1/2 at 1054 GMT.

Wakeham said that trading conditions in France, the group's largest market, are showing some signs of improvement. However, growth in sales volumes continues to be "impeded by reduced public spending and a dormant housing market".
In the UK, like-for-like sales are encouraging.
The performance of the international division continues to grow with sales above the same period of last year and profits ahead of expectation.
Wakeham said small acquisitions were being considered which will open up new markets.

Wakeham said if the current trend continued for the rest of the year, the group would be "well on course for a robust result in 1997 which will go a long way towards the fulfilment of the opportunities and ambitions created by the merger".
